moves.1. e4: This was an interesting game, where my opponent made one noticeable mistake, which- I am proud to say- I was able to capitalize on.  The main story in Batman: The Dark Knight is the Joker wants to kill Batman, so to I want to eliminate the Dark Knights (coincidentally, not planned).
moves.5. c3 O-O 6. d4: I decided to go ahead and test the center.
moves.6... exd4 7. cxd4 Bb6 8. e5 Nd5 9. Bc4 N: I think Nde7 would have been better here.
moves.10. Bg5: Now he has some serious defending to do and will wind up a pawn down.
moves.10... c6: There were other options here, but I don't know that the results would change, possibly Nb4.
moves.11. Qb3: I felt this was a good in order to continue pressure on the center as well as create a line toward blacks king.
moves.11... d6: This works to my advantage and I gain a pawn.
moves.12. Bxd5: He must take with the pawn or lose the Queen.
moves.12... cxd5 13. Bxe7 Qxe7 14. Qxd5: Now I am up a pawn, although he does have two bishops versus my knights.
moves.14... Be6 15. exd6: exd6, this was the important move in my opinion.  I'm volunteering to trade queens in order to advance my pawn.  After I made this move though, I discovered it may have been a mistake because of Bxd5, pxe7, Re8, Re1, Be6, etc.
moves.16. Qe5: I could've offered another trade with Ne5, but I didn't like the prospects from that trade, except that I could've taken another piece off of the board.  Maybe I should have.
moves.16... f6 17. Qf4 Rac8 18. Nc3 Rcd8: I think this move should've been played before.  Why Rac8 and not Rad8?
moves.19. d5 Bf7 20. Nd4 Bxd4: I offered the Knight, and he accepts.  It gains a pawn back for him, but it allows me to stack for my attack.
moves.21. Qxd4 Qxd6 22. Rad1: Stacking begins.  He should do the same, but the threat of my Knight scared him away I guess so he moves...
moves.23. Rd3: Operation Stack Attack, by the way anyone ever had a Stack Attack from Wendy's?  Delicious.  It used to be the Double Stack, but now it's Stack Attack.  Good Value though.  I have officially coined a fast food phrase for Chess, so send all royalties to ralbama1.
moves.23... Rfe8 24. Rfd1 Qe7: This was the losing move.  My opponent joked after my next move, "just wanted to make sure you were paying attention."  Well I was.
moves.25. h3 Qd6: This is where he made the joke.  Too late, I can now begin "Operation Sacrifice Knight to win Queen with Rook" or for those who have seen the latest Batman movie.  "Operation Harvey Dent."
moves.27. Nxf6+ gxf6 28. Qg4+: And I have the queen or I have both rooks.
moves.28... Kf8: He wants the rooks, and I don't blame him.
moves.31. Qxf6+ Kg8 32. Rxd8 Rxd8 33. Qxd8+ Kg: And resignation.  Anyway, good game, and Stack Attack with White Knight Harvey Dent was the winning combo.

opening: Ruy Lopez (C65), Berlin defence, Beverwijk variation
